column2: Judgment of the Court (Third Chamber) of 22 October 2009
column4: María Julia Zurita García (C-261/08) and Aurelio Choque Cabrera (C-348/08) v Delegado del Gobierno en la Región de Murcia
column5: Reference for a preliminary ruling: Tribunal Superior de Justicia de Murcia - Spain
column6: Visas; asylum and immigration - Measures concerning the crossing of external borders - Article 62(1) and (2)(a) EC - Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Articles 6b and 23 - Regulation (EC) No 562/2006 - Articles 5; 11 and 13 - Presumption concerning the duration of the stay - Unlawful presence of third-country nationals in the territory of a Member State - National legislation allowing for either a fine or expulsion; depending on the circumstances

column2: Judgment of the Court (Sixth Chamber) of 22 December 2008
column4: Criminal proceedings against Vladimir Turanský
column5: Reference for a preliminary ruling: Landesgericht für Strafsachen Wien - Austria
column6: Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Article 54 - ‘Ne bis in idem’ principle - Scope - Concept of ‘finally disposed of’ - Decision by which a police authority orders the suspension of criminal proceedings - Decision not barring further prosecution and not having a ne bis in idem effect under national law

column2: Judgment of the Court (Second Chamber) of 11 December 2008
column4: Klaus Bourquain
column5: Reference for a preliminary ruling: Landgericht Regensburg - Germany
column6: Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Article 54 - ‘Ne bis in idem’ principle - Scope - Conviction in absentia in respect of the same acts - Concept of ‘finally disposed of’ - Procedural rules of national law - Concept of ‘penalty which can no longer be enforced’

column2: Judgment of the Court (Second Chamber) of 18 July 2007
column4: Criminal proceedings against Norma Kraaijenbrink
column5: Reference for a preliminary ruling: Hof van Cassatie - Belgium
column6: Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Article 54 - Ne bis in idem principle - Notion of ‘same acts’ - Different acts - Prosecution in two Contracting States - Acts linked together by the same criminal intention

column2: Judgment of the Court (Second Chamber) of 18 July 2007
column4: Criminal proceedings against Jürgen Kretzinger
column5: Reference for a preliminary ruling: Bundesgerichtshof - Germany
column6: Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Article 54 - Ne bis in idem principle - Notion of ‘same acts’- Contraband cigarettes - Importation into several Contracting States - Prosecution in different Contracting States - Notion of ‘enforcement’ of criminal penalties - Suspension of the execution of the sentence - Setting-off of brief periods of detention pending trial - European arrest warrant

column2: Judgment of the Court (Grand Chamber) of 3 October 2006
column4: Nicolae Bot v Préfet du Val-de-Marne
column5: Reference for a preliminary ruling: Conseil d'État - France
column6: Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Article 20(1) - Conditions of movement of nationals of a third country not subject to a visa requirement - Maximum stay for a period of three months during the six months following the date of first entry into the Schengen Area - Successive stays - Definition of "first entry'

column2: Judgment of the Court (First Chamber) of 28 September 2006
column4: Jean Leon Van Straaten v Staat der Nederlanden and Republiek Italië
column5: Reference for a preliminary ruling: Rechtbank 's-Hertogenbosch - Netherlands
column6: Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Ne bis in idem principle -Meaning of "the same acts' and of "trial disposed of' - Exporting in one State and importing in another State - Acquittal of the accused

column2: Judgment of the Court (First Chamber) of 28 September 2006
column4: Criminal proceedings against Giuseppe Francesco Gasparini and Others
column5: Reference for a preliminary ruling: Audiencia Provincial de Málaga - Spain
column6: Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Article 54 - Ne bis in idem principle - Scope - Acquittal of the accused because their prosecution for the offence is time-barred

column2: Judgment of the Court (Second Chamber) of 9 March 2006
column4: Criminal proceedings against Leopold Henri Van Esbroeck
column5: Reference for a preliminary ruling: Hof van Cassatie - Belgium
column6: Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Articles 54 and 71 - Ne bis in idem principle - Application ratione temporis - Concept of "the same acts' - Import and export of narcotic drugs subject to legal proceedings in different Contracting States

column2: Judgment of the Court (Fifth Chamber) of 10 March 2005
column4: Criminal proceedings against Filomeno Mario Miraglia
column5: Reference for a preliminary ruling: Tribunale di Bologna - Italy
column6: Article 54 of the Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Principle ne bis in idem - Scope - Decision of a Member State's judicial authorities to discontinue prosecution by reason solely of the initiation of similar proceedings in another Member State

column2: Judgment of the Court of 11 February 2003
column4: Criminal proceedings against Hüseyin Gözütok (C-187/01) and Klaus Brügge (C-385/01)
column5: References for a preliminary ruling: Oberlandesgericht Köln - Germany and Rechtbank van eerste aanleg te Veurne - Belgium
column6: Convention implementing the Schengen Agreement - Ne bis in idem principle - Scope - Decisions by which the Public Prosecutor definitively discontinues criminal proceedings; without the involvement of a court; once the accused has satisfied certain conditions
